job_title: Assistant Director IS Audits in Baltimore, MD
pros: Flexible work life in the organization.

cons: teaching load can be vary a lot from course to course

job_title: Senior IS Auditor in Columbia, MD
pros: I like to work for the organization because of the great benefits they offer.
cons: There is not opportunity for career advancement within organization after many years of services.

pros: Great place to work with a small town, family atmosphere. Benefits are above average.
cons: As a state job, salaries are average and due to the size of the institution, ability for upward movement is limited.

pros: Great team and leadership for public education
cons: limitations on the number of employees placed by the state

job_title: Associate Director of IT Development in Adelphi, MD
pros: Good work environment, excellent staff, good benefits, competitive salaries.  I always enjoyed my work with UM and felt like I was well supported by my bosses.  That began to change with the new chancellor but the people I worked with/for were always excellent.
cons: It's part of the State of Maryland so it faces many challenges inherit as an agency.  It is subject to tight budgets and this is reflected in the personnel decisions coming out of the Office of the Chancellor.  Budget cuts are often passed down to the staff in layoffs or pay freezes/cuts.  Over 30 years I saw this happen every 5-6 years.

review_title: My experience at the University of Maryland Baltimore Graduate School were interesting, challenging and rewarding.
job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Baltimore, MD
pros: What i enjoyed most while working in the Graduate Admissions office was having the opportunity to interact,  learn and gain some insight about the diverse cultures of the world. It was amazing.
cons:
Some of the challenges were a bit redundant, i.e., having to interact  with very opinionated people or working with people who exhibit unethical business practices, which I had no problems addressing when necessary.
Overall, I enjoyed my professional/working environment.

review_title: It was a company that you could see yourself working for for as long as you wanted.
pros: The benefits are unparalelled. they cared about your growth. Just because they wanted you to work for them for an indefinite period of time, didn't mean that you were to be left without educational/growth experiences.
cons:
Some suoervisors are illequipped for their position. They use the professional field that is the University to cover up their personal distate for those under them within their department.
Also entry level positions should be paid more. Merit-based raises must return.

review_title: Great plaice to work, and located in a great community
job_title: Junior Researcher in College Park, MD
pros: Working in a research consortium (START) at the university, there are always the perks have having interesting work, talented colleagues, and the opportunity to learn and develop new skills. Outstanding benefits in terms of vacation days.
cons: Salary is uncompetitive compared to private sector. Paths for promotion through the PTK plan may alleviate this, however, like any bureaucracy it takes a few years to do anything. Administration may make the consortium and institution financially unsustainable.
senior leadership has little to no involvement and does not support their managers

review_title: UMCP - Some Depts are toxic, others are good
